meanings.definition: Theosophy: religious philosophy or speculation about the nature of the divine and the universe, based on mystical insight
meanings.sent1: Studying theosophy helps people understand the mysteries of the universe.
meanings.sent2: Many ancient cultures had their own form of theosophy to explain the world around them.
meanings.sent3: Theosophy enthusiasts enjoy pondering the secrets of the cosmos in their free time.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a library filled with theosophy, each book a different aspect of the divine.
meanings.sent5: Theosophy is like a key that unlocks the hidden knowledge of the universe.

meanings.definition: Theosophy: a system of belief or religious philosophy based on mystical insight or experience
meanings.sent1: Theosophy guides its followers in understanding the spiritual realm.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, theosophy plays a central role in shaping their worldview.
meanings.sent3: Theosophy believers often gather to discuss their mystical experiences over tea.
meanings.sent4: Her heart beat with the rhythm of theosophy, each pulse a connection to the divine.
meanings.sent5: Theosophy is a beacon of light in the darkness of uncertainty.
